page.title: 20CHIEF SCOUTS VISIT TO THURSO
page.content: On Friday 14th June 1985{Chief Scout {Major General Michael Walsh}landed in a field near our school by helicopter. All Beavers, Cubs, Scouts and Venture Scouts in{Caithness}were assembled for his visit. For the Scouts there were 8 different bases to try out their various skills. At one base we made dough into twists and cooked them over a barbecue. We could also roast apples. Other bases included the cannon race, amateur radio, dry ski slope, abseiling, army assault course and leather branding. The previous evening each Scout troop competed in building a gate for their camp. We built a portcullis and were awarded second prize. The highlight of the day was the presentation of the Chief Scout's award to five scouts, four of whom are in our troop which is 1st Thurso.
